chapter.title: APPENDIX D: LIST OF WORKS CONSULTED

item.bib: Alston, R. C. "Prosody." A Bibliography of the English Language from the Invention of Printing to the Year 1800.
item.notes: A Corrected Reprint of Vols. I–X. Ilkey: Janus Press, 1974. Vol. VI, pp. 88–92.

item.bib: Attridge, Derek. Well-Weighed Syllables. London: Cambridge University Press, 1974. (E112)
Bailey, James. Toward a Statistical Analysis of English Verse. Lisse (The Netherlands): Peter de Ridder Press, 1965. (E469)
Bailey, Richard W., and Dolores M. Burton. English Stylistics: A Bibliography. Cambridge, Mass.: M.I.T. Press, 1965.
item.notes: Citation data in this work is frequently erroneous; annotations are intermittent but occasionally very long.

item.bib: Baird, Lorrayne Y. "Style Including Versification and Puns." A Bibliography of Chaucer, 1964–1973. Boston: G. K. Hall, 1977. pp. 58–61.
Bjorklund, Beth. A Study in Comparative Prosody: English and German Jambic Pentameter. Stuttgart: Akademischer Verlag Hans-Dieter Heinz, 1978. (E818)
item.notes: A useful bibliography containing 444 entries on English and German prosody (especially the latter, historically), with some lesser interest in Russian.

item.bib: Bliss, A. J. "Prosody and Prose Rhythm." The New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature. Ed. George Watson. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1974. cols. 33–52.
item.notes: Unfortunately, the NCBEL reprinted CBEL citations without verification, and consequently the citation data in NCBEL is often unreliable. Nor is there any distinction between trivial and important entries in this very long list of brief titles. But the abridged, one-volume edition of the NCBEL recently an- nounced for publication should improve in the reliability of its citation data, based on corrections supplied by this writer.

item.bib: British Museum Subject Catalog of Modern Books Acquired. London, 1881–1960 (excepting 1951–55).
item.notes: S.v. "Poetry: Prosody."

item.bib: Chandler, Albert R., and E. N. Barnhart. "Experiments on Affective Reactions and Form." A Bibliography of Psychological and Experimental Aesthetics, 1864–1937. Berkeley: University of California Press, 1938. pp. 83–90.
Comprehensive Dissertation Index. Ann Arbor: Xerox University Microfilms. Volumes for 1861–1978.
item.notes: Subject headings searched: Aesthetic(s), Alliteration, Assonance, Ballad Metre, Blank Verse, Couplet, Foot, Form, Free Verse, Iambic, Line, Lyric, Meter, Metre, Metrical, Ode, Poem, Poetic, Poetics, Poetry, Prosody, Rhyme-Rime, Rhythm, Sonnet, Sound, Stanza, Structure, Style, Stylistics, Syntax, Verse, Versification.

item.bib: Ebisch, Walther, and Levin L. Schucking. "Shakespeare's Language, Vocabulary, Prosody, and Style." A Shakespeare Bibliography. Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1931. pp. 79– 94.
item.notes: Also in Supplement for the Years 1930–1935 to A Shakespeare Bibliography. Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1937. pp. 29–31.

item.bib: Fry, Donald K. "Beowulf" and "The Fight at Finnsburh": A Bibliography. Charlottesville: The University Press of Virginia, 1969.
item.notes: S.v. "Meter" (188 entries) and "Diction" (128 entries) in the Subject-Index.

item.bib: Gabel, Gernot U., and G. R. Gabel. Dissertations in English and American Literature: Theses Accepted by Austrian, French, and Swiss Universities, 1875–1970.
item.notes: Hamburg: the author, 1977. 198 pp.

item.bib: Griffith, Dudley D. "Style Including Versification" and "Language." Bibliography of Chaucer 1908–1953. Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1955. pp. 116–42.
Hammond, Eleanor C. "Linguistics and Versification." Chaucer: A Bibliographical Manual. New York: The Macmillan Company, 1908;
item.notes: rpt. New York: Peter Smith, 1933. pp. 464–509. (K149)

item.bib: Huckabay, Calvin. "Style and Versification." John Milton: An Annotated Bibliography 1929– 1968. Pittsburgh: Duquesne University Press, 1960;
International Index to Periodicals. New York: H. W. Wilson Company, 1907–65.
item.notes: After 1965 the series title changes to Social Sciences and Humanities Index until 1974; after 1974 the title is Humanities Index, as the previously composite in- dex is divided into two annual volumes. Valuable as a resource because it cov- ers, especially in the earlier years, a considerable number of both scholarly and popular journals that the MLA did not include. Relevant subject headings vary from decade to decade, but the most productive are: Alliteration, English Language--Rhythm, English Language--Rime, English Language--Versification, English Language--Old English, English Language--Middle English, Poetics, Rime, Shakespeare, William-- Versification, Versification.

item.bib: Jochum, K. P. S. W. B. Yeats: A Classified Bibliography of Criticism. Urbana, Ill.: University of Illinois Press, 1978.
item.notes: S.v. "Prosody," "Rhyme," and "Rhythm" in the Index.

item.bib: Kluewer, Jeffrey D. "An Annotated Check List of Writings on Linguistics and Literature in the Sixties." Bulletin of the New York Public Library 76 (1972): 36–91.
item.notes: Given the restrictions of scope evident in its title, this checklist is the most thorough resource of its kind I have seen. Arranged alphabetically are 288 en- tries, nearly all of them annotated generously, followed by eleven Indexes: Bib- liographies, Collections, Theories of Language, Linguistics and Literary Criti- cism, Linguistic Schools, Prosody, Psycholinguistics, Qualitative Studies, Style and Stylistics, Syntax and Grammar, and Non-Prosodic Analysis of Literary Periods and Authors and Works. Index VI on Prosody (pp. 82–85) contains subsections indexing Meter and Rhythm, Phonology--Sound Texture, Sound and Meaning, Suprasegmentals--Performance, and Prosodic Analyses (by author and poem). The cross-referencing system used here is awkward, but the superabundance of indexes is more than compensatory.

item.bib: Kökeritz, Helge. Shakespeare's Pronunciation. New Haven: Yale University Press, 1953. (C17)

Lafourcade, Françoise. "Contribution à une bibliographie chronologique pour l'étude des théories sur la versification anglaise de 1550 à 1950." In Hommage à Paul Dottin. Caliban (Annales Publiées par la Faculté des Lettres et Sciences Humaines de Toulouse). N.s. 2, fascicle 1, no. 3 (Special Issue), 1966. pp. 271–317. (A27)
Library of Congress Catalogs. Books: Subjects. Washington, D.C.: Library of Congress, 1955 (for 1950–54)--.
item.notes: Title varies. See the following principal headings for English: Alliteration, Blank Verse, Chaucer, Geoffrey--Versification, English Language-- Versification, Free Verse, Shakespeare, William--Versification, Versification.

item.bib: McNamee, Lawrence F. Dissertations in English and American Literature: Theses Accepted in English, American and German Universities 1865–1964. New York: R. R. Bowker, 1968.
item.notes: Also -----. Supplement One 1964–1968. New York, 1969, and -----. Supplement Two 1969–1973. New York, 1974.

item.bib: Malof, Joseph. A Manual of English Meters. Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 1970. (E581)
Martin, Willard E., Jr. "Language" and "Metrics." A Chaucer Bibliography 1925–1933. Durham: Duke University Press, 1935. pp. 33–37.
Milic, Lewis T. Style and Stylistics: An Annotated Bibliography. New York: The Free Press, 1967.
item.notes: Uses a system of descriptors rather than prose annotations to indicate content.

item.bib: Modern Humanities Research Association. Annual Bibliography of English Language and Literature. London: Modern Humanities Research Association, 1920–-.
item.notes: I have searched the volumes for 1920 through 1975, entire. See the annual section on "Metre"; beginning in 1971, the section on "Language, Literature, and the Computer"; and beginning in 1973, the section on "Stylistics."

item.bib: Modern Language Association of America. International Bibliography. New York: Modern Language Association, 1920--.
item.notes: I have searched the volumes for 1920 through 1968, and the General, English, American, and Linguistics sections of volumes I and III for 1969 through 1978, entire. Unlike the MHRA bibliography, the Postmodern MLA has no section for the traditional subject of Versification, so the student of form must find his sources by the traditional method--reading from cover to cover. Vol- ume III on Linguistics contains a section on "Stylistics," and also a section on "Prosody (Suprasegmentals)." From the title of this latter section, one would expect it to treat aspects of speech (Pitch, Timing, Juncture)--which it does-- but it also includes articles on meter and versification, using "Prosody" in the old sense of the term, wherein versification was a subcategory of Grammar. But by preserving the old conception the MLA preserves the old confusions; it is difficult to imagine a rational justification for this organization. As of January 1979, however, the MLA Bibliographies for 1976–1977 are available for computer searching on a data base in the Lockheed system; a scan for all the variants of the keywords Prosody, Meter, and Versification should net most items of interest. Note also that there is a published Index to vols. 1–50 of PMLA, wherein see s.v. "Metre," "Rhythm," "Rime," and "Versification" (these are not restricted to English).

item.bib: Mummendey, Richard. "Prosody." Language and Literature of the Anglo-Saxon Nations as Presented in German Doctoral Dissertations 1885–1950: A Bibliography. Charlottesville: Bibliographical Society of the University of Virginia, 1954. pp. 36–38.
Mustanoja, Tauono F. "Chaucer's Prosody." Companion to Chaucer Studies. Ed. Beryl Rowland. New York: Oxford University Press, 1968. pp. 58–84. (K266)
Nager, Rae Ann. "English: II. Bibliographical." Versification: Major Language Types. Ed. K. W. Wimsatt, Jr. New York: New York University Press for MLA, 1972. pp. 204–16. (A28)
item.notes: Brief annotations for 126 well-known sources. -----. "A Selective Annotated Bibliography of Recent Work on English Prosody." Style 11 (1977): 136–70. (A29)

item.bib: Omond, T. S. English Metrists. Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1921; rpt. New York: Phaeton Press, 1968. (A5)
Preminger, Alex, ed. The Princeton Encyclopedia of Poetry and Poetics. Enlarged ed. Princeton: Princeton University Press, 1974. (A18)
item.notes: For the study of English versification the relevant articles (all of which con- clude with a bibliography) are the following: Accent, Alliteration, Alliterative Meter, Analysis, Assonance, Ballad Meter, Blank Verse, Cadence, Caesura, Christabel Meter, Classical Meters in Modern Verse, Conceptions of Poetics, Couplet, English Poetry, English Prosody, Explication, Form, Free Verse, Generative Metrics, Heroic Couplet, Hexameter, Linguistics and Poetics, Lyric Meter, Metrical Variation, Music and Poetry, Ode, Phenomenology, Poetic Diction, Poetry Reading, Poly- phonic Prose, Prose Poem, Prose Rhythm, Prosodic Notation, Prosody, Rhyme, Rules, Scansion, Sonnet, Sound in Poetry, Structure, Style, Stylistics, Texture, Theories of Poetry, Tone-Color, Verse and Prose.

item.bib: Roberts, Thomas J. "Literary-Linguistics: A Bibliography, 1946–1961." Texas Studies in Literature and Language 4 (1962): 625–29.
Roth, Sister Mary Augustine, ed. Coventry Patmore's "Essay on English Metrical Law": A Critical Edition with a Commentary. Washington, D.C.: Catholic University of America Press, 1961. (E385)

Schramm, Wilbur L. "Objective Studies of Verse: A Bibliography." Approaches to a Science of English Verse. University of Iowa Studies, Series on Aims and Progress of Research, no. 46. Iowa City: The University, 1935. pp. 76–82. (E428)
item.notes: Generous annotations on the major works up to 1935 which apply the meth- ods of Acoustics (Phonetics) to English versification.

item.bib: Sebeok, Thomas A., ed. Style in Language. Cambridge, Mass.: M.I.T. Press, 1960. (A19)

Severs, J. Burke, ed., and continued by Albert E. Hartung. A Manual of Writings in Middle English 1050–1500. 5 vols. New Haven: Archon/Shoe String for the Connecticut Academy of Arts and Sciences, 1967–75.
item.notes: The successor to Wells. There is usually a subsection on Versification listed un- der each poem entry in the Bibliography in each volume, but as the section heads are extremely difficult to distinguish typographically I cannot recom- mend using these volumes extensively.

item.bib: Shapiro, Karl. A Bibliography of Modern Prosody. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press, 1948. (A30)
item.notes: Long, discursive annotations, but relatively few entries.
